raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "Extracellular space", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "This patient has signs of scurvy (vitamin C deficiency): fatigue, gum bleeding/swelling, petechiae, low BMI, and hemarthrosis. Vitamin C is required for the hydroxylation of proline and lysine residues during collagen synthesis, which occurs in the extracellular space. The defect is in collagen cross-linking, leading to fragile blood vessels and poor wound healing. The relevant reaction (collagen cross-linking) occurs in the extracellular space."}
